ads.author: Alec Landeta
ads.title: Skillshot FX Digital Pinball
ads.description: Skillshot FX isn't just a digital pinball machine, it's a portal to your childhood arcade dreams. Relive 96 iconic pinball tables, from Star Wars and Marvel to classic Williams titles, all on a stunning 55" 4K display housed in a sleek, Merapi wood-grain cabinet that's as beautiful as it is fun. Real flipper feedback, immersive sound, and haptic effects that make Boba Fett jump and Spiderman glide across your screen, while Wi-Fi connectivity ensures you'll never miss out on future updates or downloadable tables. So gather your friends and family, casual players and "pinheads" alike, for endless hours of entertainment with Skillshot FX. Whether you are looking to dominate your at-home local leaderboard or expand your digital pinball gameplay online, Skillshot FX is sure to bring people together – at home, or outside the comfort of your family room, if you so chose. Skillshot FX digital pinball is equipped with WiFi connectivity, allowing for unlimited future software updates, multiplayer matchups, user generated tournaments, league play, and more. All you need is a free Steam account.

ads.author: Zachary Meny
ads.title: The Walking Dead Remastered Pinball Machine - Limited Edition (LE) & Premium Edition
ads.description: The Walking Dead Remastered pinball machine by Stern Pinball Limited Edition (LE) (LIMITED TO ONLY 500 UNITS!) $12,999 + FREE SHIPPING Premium Edition $9,699 + FREE SHIPPING Trades Accepted & We Can Ship To Anywhere In The USA IN STOCK - READY TO SHIP ORDER YOURS TODAY FROM FLIP N OUT PINBALL flipnoutpinball.com [hidden information] [hidden information] [hidden information] [hidden information] [hidden information] [hidden information] Stern Pinball, Inc., the largest designer and manufacturer of pinball games in the world, in partnership with AMC Networks revealed and released The Walking Dead Remastered – a technologically advanced version of one of the most beloved pinball games of all time featuring one of the most well-known franchises in the world, AMC’s The Walking Dead. This property has captivated global audiences since its television premiere in 2010. The hit TV series, spin-off shows, video games, merchandise, and more have reshaped the modern landscape of horror storytelling. Powered by Stern’s new SPIKE 3 technology platform, Stern Pinball is excited to bring to life The Walking Dead Remastered to the current generation of pinball players, taking them on an epic journey through legendary moments from the series as they fight to survive the apocalypse. The Walking Dead Remastered pinball game is available now in Premium and Limited Edition (LE) models, along with a full line of accessories available soon. In Stern Pinball’s The Walking Dead Remastered pinball game, players will battle walkers and survive key scenes from The Walking Dead in an immersive physical pinball experience like none other. The development team, led by John Borg, the designer of the original game, have created a modern version of the original masterpiece. The playfield features enhanced versions of the “Cell Block C” Prison building, bicycle girl ramp, and an interactive Well Walker toy. The fan-favorite crossbow device that shoots a pinball has been re-engineered and updated for increased precision and flexibility in gameplay. The game also features new RGB lighting and illuminated zombie heads on the slingshots. Extra care and attention to detail have gone into every facet of The Walking Dead Remastered, honoring the original masterpiece by John Borg and Lyman F. Sheats, Jr. The game includes an updated version of the revolutionary ruleset that introduced a new mode structure and risk-reward elements that have stood the test of time. Through the iconic Prison, Well Walker, and Blood Bath multiballs and the depth of each Dead Feature mode (Barn, CDC, Riot, Tunnel, and Arena), players are immersed in a pinball battle that can ultimately leave a “Last Man Standing”... that is, if you’re able to survive the Horde and escape Terminus along your adventure. In The Walking Dead Remastered, players will be introduced to newly developed visuals that blend high-quality video elements with a vibrant painterly art style, both on the cabinet and on the display. Extraordinary care has been taken to ensure the new visuals mirror scenes from the classic game, while also going beyond with additional updates. Software enhancements will introduce additional game rules, including new custom audio call-outs from actors Michael Rooker (Merle) and Danai Gurira (Michonne). Players will also experience Stern’s Insider Connected (IC) system that provides advanced connectivity features, enabling real-time engagement and a more connected experience for all. The Walking Dead Remastered features Stern’s next-generation SPIKE 3 technology platform, which includes a larger 18.5” full HD display with true color depth, along with a more powerful processor, and a new high fidelity immersive audio system. Players will get to experience completely overhauled 3D-rendered graphics and custom animations that pay homage to the dot matrix display from the original pinball machine. SPIKE 3 electronics also feature more efficient power handling, improved Wi-Fi support, and wireless headphone capabilities. This release will also feature an updated cabinet lighting customization system designed to allow for internal and external expression lighting on all versions of the game. Limited to 500 games globally, the highly collectible Limited Edition model includes the updated Expression Lighting SystemTM and Speaker Expression Lighting System with The Walking Dead-themed game effects, a full-color mirrored backglass, full-color high-definition cabinet decals, exclusive custom The Walking Dead Remastered pinball armor, a custom designer-autographed bottom arch, upgraded audio system, anti-reflection pinball playfield glass, shaker motor, a sequentially numbered plaque, a signed Certificate of Authenticity, and a digital Insider Connected LE owner’s badge on registration. “The Walking Dead is one of the most memorable and influential pinball games in our time, and we’re proud of the entire Stern team for elevating this iconic game onto our new platform,” said Seth Davis, President & CEO of Stern Pinball. “We’re always looking to create new immersive and thrilling gameplay experiences in pinball, and there’s no better way to do that than by bringing The Walking Dead back from the dead and to an entirely new generation of zombie lovers and pinball players.”

ads.author: Guy Martin
ads.title: Unique WATCHE from Mr. Jones
ads.description: IMPORTANT NOTE: If you want to see all of my Facebook Marketplace listings (Collectables, Fashion, Watches, Automobilia, Art, Household items etc.) when looking at a listing, look to the right side of the page with the listing details. Scroll down to find the seller information with my photo. Next, click on seller details, scroll to the bottom of that page and you'll see all of my listings. Our home is smoke free, pet, free, child free, and we do not wear outside shoes in our home. All items are in excellent condition unless otherwise specified. We live off Las Olas on Hendricks Isle. Cash only upon pick up. Mr. Jones Watch Ricochet $325 Get lost in time with the Ricochet watch. Ricochet is inspired by the world of the pinball arcade and was designed for us by Ryan Claytor. The three metallic robots, engrossed in the action of the pinball machine were each gilded by hand in a different metallic foil palladium, 20ct. citron gold and 22ct. rose gold. The scoreboard of the game shows you the hours and minutes. This watch has a jump hour movement, so you'll need to watch closely to see the hour change - blink and you'll miss it! Ricochet was a real labor of love to produce, each watch representing many hours of work by our small, talented team. • Medium / unisex size • Sapphire glass (hard-wearing) • TY2709 20 jewel automatic mechanical movement • Jump hour movement • Waterproof! Rated 5ATM • 316L stainless steel case • 18mm stainless steel strap About the Artist • Ryan Claytor • Ryan, who has a deep love for pinball, considers the links between the game and time: • “Pinball is essentially a game of timing: flip a fraction of a second too soon or too late and you'll miss your intended target. • In its more transcendent moments though, a game of pinball can almost mystically remove the player from any concept of time. • When engrossed in a game where shots are being hit, progress being made and previously locked achievements are realized, pinball has the capacity to transport the player out of time entirely. • Rest assured, though, that "Ricochet" will be a faithful temporal reminder once you resurface from this engrossing experience!” • Ryan Claytor is an award-winning American Comics Creator and professor at Michigan State University (MSU) where he teaches Comics Studio courses, heads the Comic Art and Graphic Novel interdisciplinary minor and directs the MSU Comics Forum. • Claytor creates non-fiction comics that, most recently, focus on the history of electro-mechanical coin-operated amusement devices (pinball and arcade games manufactured prior to the implementation of solid-state technology in 1978). • Additionally, he is the Host and Producer of the MSU Comic Art and Graphic Novel Podcast and designs custom neon signs.

ads.description: Up for sale is a beautiful 1974 Gottlieb Top Card pinball machine. I am listing this machine, along with another pitch and bat machine for a friend who is not on social media. This game has undergone a ground up restoration, with the cabinet being repainted using professional stencils back to its original graphics. The game has been cleaned and restored mechanically and plays great! The playfield is in great condition, as is the back glass. This game was originally purchased from an operator who removed it from his route back in the day, after only a few months, due to someone damaging the front door in an attempt to break it. The game only has 13,xxx plays on it, due to being in storage for 50 years. The game has a new reproduction front door, legs, and many other parts. It is a beautiful game which must be seen in person and played. If interested, please contact me and I can put you in touch with the owner for any arrangements. Asking $1,900 OBO. Cash only. ads.author: Gabe Gregory
ads.title: Gottlieb Abra Ca Dabra 1975 Pinball machine
ads.description: I'm listing my Gottlieb Abra Ca Dabra after owning it for several years. I love it but it is taking up limited space and it doesn't get much play anymore. I purchased this game shopped from the Pinball Dudes in Jupiter, FL. They did a full shop job and the game plays great, pretty much exactly like it did when I brought it home. It is hi-tapped. It's not in perfect shape, the cab and the playfield have some wear from being on location for many years though I do think for almost 79,000 plays it looks very good. Please refer to the pictures. A couple of the plastics are chipped as well. As far as mechanical issues are concerned, a few of the playfield and backbox light sockets have gone out over time and need replacing (I am 99% sure it is sockets since most of the game is LED'd), but of course this doesn't impact gameplay. I'm asking $1500 but am open to offers, I'm not really in a rush to sell and am just looking to see what's out there. Cash only, pickup in Kissimmee. More pics here: https://imgur.com/a/bnoKG6y

ads.author: Brian Harris
ads.title: Need For Speed Underground & Carbon Arcade
ads.description: This is the cockpit version of Need For Speed Underground AND it also plays Need For Speed Carbon. Both games are loaded on separate hard drives. The games are switched by powering off the cabinet, flipping the switch to the desired game, powering the machine back on and selecting the appropriate dongle. Best part is all of this can be done from inside the coin door. The cabinet is in great shape as well and has the original massive CRT installed. The 6-speed shifter along with the steering/force feedback works great! Game is on wheels and comes apart in the center for easy moving. Spare parts are also included: memory chips, CD ROMS, parts PC, the topper pieces from an original NFS along with the original NFS game installed on a hard drive with dongle and sequential shifter (this actually gives you a 3rd NFS game!). I can ship but price varies depending on location.

It has new legs and levelers, along with a new power cord. This machine has been meticulously serviced: score reels were removed and cleaned, contacts cleaned and replaced where needed, new rubber installed, and a new ball added. All plastics are original or replaced as needed. The original incandescent bulbs have been replaced with LEDs throughout, with warm white LEDs beautifully lighting the playfield. A wonderful nostalgia piece for a home game room that plays very well and is ready for many more years of enjoyment. Reasonable offers accepted. Local delivery possible.

ads.author: Tom Grizzard
ads.title: 1992 Konami X-Men video arcade (PLEASE READ COMMENTS)
ads.description: 1992 Konami X-Men video arcade game is a retro collectible arcade gaming machine that allows players to experience the popular X-Men franchise through interactive gameplay. With Konami's reputation for quality and innovation, this arcade game offers a nostalgic gaming experience for fans of the series and collectors of vintage arcade machines. Featuring the iconic X-Men characters and storyline, this video arcade game is a must-have for any gaming enthusiast looking to add a piece of arcade history to their collection. THE GOOD: Cabinet is in great overall condition. Monitor has no issues. Joysticks work fine, might be loose for some likeness/favor but nothing a new centering grommet would not solve... and not seized for removal as I did remove to clean and made adjustments, and shafts were cleaned well so wouldn't seize in near future (for easy removal). THE BAD: Original gameboard took a dump on me, and cost to replace is hovering around $1000.00... so, I installed a Pandora's DX box (turning off all games except X-men, so boots directly into game) and wiring the player 3 and player 4 control in via two "USB Joystick" pcb wiring adapters. The Pandora DX does support 4 players in Konomi X-Men with only one quirk that is not an issue... when you start either player three or player four you get player three, followed by player four... no big deal at all... besides that one super minor quirk everything works as it should. To be clear, you can play a three player or a four player game no problem, and you can pick who is each... you just get player 3 controls first regardless if you hit player 3 or player 4 start, followed by play 4 controls if you hit either player 3 or player 4 start after starting a 3 player game first. I see no sound or video issues WHATSOEVER playing X-Men on the Pandora's Box DX... NONE! As a convenience, I added 4 free-play buttons just above each of the coin chutes (small red start push buttons like on 1980's midway cocktail tables, barely noticeable) on the two top coindoors for any home user purchase.... those can easily be taken disabled and the coin mechs for all four players work fine if buyer wishes to collected revenue. Will ship via freight carrier at Buyer's expense. Local pickup allowed and encouraged (zip 31525). Local delivery (from Savannah down to Jacksonville) available for nominal fee.

This is a complete and genuine Mutoscope viewer, restored to vintage condition on its original iron stand. The Marquee and reel match.This Mutoscope machine works great on free play. It has locks and side door key. Beautiful restored condition. The bulb lights the viewing pictures and crank works. Complete with an exciting “explosive “ movie . Stands over 6′ tall. $3600 OBO.

ads.title: *** Vintage Coin Operated “Big Rig Trucking” Arcade
ads.description: This is a rare Benchmark coin operated game that diapenses tickets. Works great! Brand new coin slots mechanisms. (Could use the tokens or quarters or any coins) All cleaned up and working as should. Lots of fun to play. Big Rig Truckin’ is a fast-paced skill-based quick coin game loaded with targets and tons of play appeal. With a construction/dump truck theme, your goal is to fill a dump truck with coins then to dump the payload. There are four trucks installed on the playfield, each with their own “Dump Payload” sign. To hit that sign, it takes precision and skill to time those coin drops down the ramp just right. A coin in the truckbed wins 10 tickets while dumped coins win 5 tickets per coin!. ondition: good make / manufacturer: benchmark size / dimensions: 50.5"x38.5"x62 On wheels and could assist with delivery. Located in North Port

It’s a great piece for collectors or anyone looking to add a unique game to their lineup. Condition: • Cabinet is very old and needs some love. • Monitor powers on, image is good, but probably needs new caps for long-term reliability. • Lights come on. • Sound works. • Controls are functional. • Sold as-is. Highlights: • Classic Capcom sports arcade with bowling gameplay. • Upright cabinet design from the golden age of arcades. • Fully playable — monitor, sound, lights, and controls all working. • Great candidate for restoration or display in a retro collection. Important: • Price is $425, negotiable but only slightly. • Serious buyers only.

It’s a top quality TOTAN and I hate to get rid of it, but we are moving to a home where I will no longer have a basement. Tales of the Arabian Nights is a 1996 pinball machine from Williams. Players can experience 7 Tales of the Arabian Nights that includes a travel around the ancient city of Baghdad, flying with the magic carpet and battling the evil genie. Rubbing the magic lamp conjure good genies that help to rescue the princess. The game uses a vertical magnet diverter that grabs the ball and hurls it back at the player for more suspense as an industry first. ads.author: Allen Robinson
ads.title: Pole Position, Upright Arcade, Atari/Namco 1982
ads.description: Vintage Upright Arcade – Pole Position (Atari/Namco, November 1982) Price: $475, Negotiable (but not by much) Step into racing history with this original Pole Position upright cabinet — one of the most iconic arcade racers ever made. Released in 1982 by Atari/Namco, Pole Position was a groundbreaking driving simulator that set the standard for racing games. It’s widely recognized as one of the Top 50 most historically important video games of all time. Condition: - Cabinet is very old and needs some love. - Boards need work and likely new caps. - Monitor does not power on. - Lights come on. - No sound currently. - This is a project cabinet — perfect for restoration enthusiasts or collectors. Highlights: - Classic upright racer with simulator-style gameplay. - Rare piece of arcade history from the golden age. - Great candidate for restoration or display in a collection. Important: - Price is negotiable, but only slightly. - Sold as-is. - Serious buyers only. No I don’t deliver but it can be picked up or shipped (arranged by buyer) in Powder Springs, GA.

ads.title: Rare Galaxian Arcade Game
ads.description: Here we have an all original only one to be known to exist Galaxian arcade game made by Dale industries back in the 80's. Serial number 1001, we believe this is the very first one ever created. It made it into the states across the Canadian Border at some point and was found in a storage unit from a collection in Idaho believed to be part of the Grinkers Arcade collection. Everything in this game is all original and working. It is running a midway Galaxian board because it is less glitchy and more reliable. We will include the original working board set which is a bootleg type board for nostalgia's sake to keep it all real. What you see in the video is the game running the original bootleg type board not the Midway version board. This game in this cabinet is extremely rare. We have not seen another one like it.

ads.author: Jeff Harding
ads.title: 2 -Dead Heat Street Racing 32" Arcade Driving Game
ads.description: We have two Dead Heat racing games, selling both for $6900 or $3900 each. Dead Heat is the exhilarating, high definition, head-to-head car racing game from Namco. The game involves eight racers, and links up to four real-time players. It's not just the neck-and-neck style of this game that sets it apart, but the unique use of the player profiles and the in-game player identification gives it an edge as well. Using a PIN system like other racing games, players can store information such as high scores and friends/competitors you've played, but the profile also stores players driving styles. If your friend isn't able to make a race, no problem, just apply your friends driving style, and the computer will simulate their driving style for you to race against! Namco have also addressed the issue of trying to figure out which cars are your friends on the course by taking a snapshot of players before the race, and displays the photo above the players vehicles, making it easier to find and eliminate your friends on the track. Dead Heat Arcade Driving Game Features: 32" LCD screen Players profiles available through PIN system to store high scores, and keep track of friends and competitors. Driving style is also stored as information,so players can race against friends who aren't present at the time. Camera on machine takes players photo before race, and displays photo above the players car during race for easy identification. 8 customizable cars to choose from (both Japanese and American). Race locations are geographically accurate to the real locations. Links up to four players

ads.author: Donald Hopkins
ads.title: Punny Factory (Engraved LE)- Pinball Adventures - Ultra Rare
ads.description: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iGXkKwjBpYI This is an interesting game with a sordid past. It is the 2nd NIB game I ever bought (TNA CE was 1st). It arrived with some playfield damage that the owner of Pinball Adventures said he'd take care of. Sadly, Andrew McBain never did honor his promises to send a new playfield. So, the game still has the damage. They were supposed to make 10 of these engraved editions but I think they only made 1 or 2. It might be one of the rarest games on pinside. If you look at the engraved edition you will see only 1 person has this game in their collection. I don't think there's another pinball game on pinside that has only 1 owner. If you want to own a game no one else has, this is it!

ads.description: Phone as the Screen: Your phone slots into the center, acting as the display, while the controller provides physical joysticks, D-pad, and buttons. Connectivity: Connects via USB-C (for newer phones) or Lightning (for iPhones) for low latency, or via Bluetooth for wireless play. Game Compatibility: Works with any game or service that supports controllers, including native iOS/Android titles, Apple Arcade, Xbox Game Pass, Steam Link, and more. Cloud & Remote Play: Allows streaming games from Xbox, PlayStation, or PC directly to your phone, making console gaming portable. Backbone App: An integrated app organizes your game library, launches games, and offers recommendations. Ergonomics: Designed for comfort, mimicking traditional console controllers (like Xbox or PlayStation) for better control than touchscreens.

ads.author: Jason Sillay
ads.title: (PENDING) Vintage Space Invaders Pinball Machine
ads.description: $1,800 OBO 100% function Brand new MPU board New small replacement flippers uninstalled Interested, buyers are free to come by and inspect the machine. Excellent candidate for a 100% restore. All original! Players condition In 1980, Bally released a pinball version of the original 1978 Video game of the same name becoming the first pinball to be based on a video game. Bally's video game division, Midway, had licensed Space Invaders from Taito in Japan, and decided to capitalize on the machine's incredible success by using it as a theme for a pinball. However, few elements from the original game, except for the sounds and front case artwork, were included in the pinball game. The artwork instead resembled the xenomorphs from the 1979 film "Alien". Bally was sued over the game's artwork resemblance to designs by H. R. Giger. In fact, they ended up stopping production of the game early due to pending lawsuits, although 11,400 machines were still produced. A settlement was reached with Fox studios where royalties were paid to the studio for each pinball machine sold and Fox was also given approximately 3 machines to use for the promotion of the sequel to Alien, named "Aliens". This machine was one of only 5 "widebodies" released for production by Bally.

ads.author: Aldo Rodrigo
ads.title: STAR TREK Pro Pinball Machine
ads.description: An excellent condition Star Trek Pro for sale. HUO - Documented (Home used only). I’m the only owner, bought NIB and I take meticulous care of my pin. Pin come from a pet and smoke free home. Low lifetime plays. A lot of professional mods installed: Vengeance Led Light Vengeance Visor Asteroid Belt Asteroid Ramp Bird of Prey Ship§ Enterprise Ship Mirror Blades Honey Comb Movie Cards Button Protectors NCC-1701 Metal Plate Speakers Icon Enterprise Topper Planet Topper Led Light Topper Back/Bottom Led Lights Warp Light Below Enterprise Keychain Inspired by the Star Trek and Star Trek Into Darkness films, the newest Stern machine puts players in Captain James Kirk's chair of the U.S.S. Enterprise, embarking on a journey to protect and defend the planets of the Federation. Stern's Star Trek pinball machine features all the bells and whistles a Star Trek fan would desire. With adrenalin-filled battles, high-definition artwork, cosmic LED lighting and classic musical scores, the Star Trek game will evoke the sensation of flying through space at Warp Speed to rescue Spock and defeat the U.S.S. Vengeance. The newest game from Stern includes an animated battleship, three lightning fast ramps, three flippers, resettable memory drop targets and much more. Star Trek is Stern's first all-LED Pro Model. The playfield features seven multicolored LED paths that lead gamers on easy-to-understand color-coded routes. There are six missions for casual players matched by 18 complex treks to immerse enthusiast players deeper in the game. As players attack an oncoming threat with three action-centered flippers, the all-LED playfield will captivate onlookers and enhance the player experience with features like phaser flashes and photon torpedoes. Players will instinctively know exactly what to do when they approach Star Trek pinball – destroy the U.S.S. Vengeance, a key action-packed feature on the playing field. From the very start, players will have the chance to unlock special opportunities, collect tantalizing bonus features and win a series of accolades called The Captain's Chair. Star Trek aficionados can expect the classic battle between the heroic Enterprise team and the villainous Khan as well as run-ins with Nero, Klingons and the Narada.

ads.author: Richard Redd
ads.title: (RARE) Gottlieb Nudge-It Upright Arcade / Pinball Game, Circa 1990
ads.description: This is an original Nudge-It upright arcade pinball-style game produced by Gottlieb (Premier Technology) around 1990. Nudge-It Is a distinctive and unconventional entry ir Gottlied's late-era catalog, designed without traditional flippers. Instead, gameplay relies on a spring-loaded plunger and controlled cabinet nudging to guide the ball into illuminated scoring lanes, creating a hybric experience between pinball and skill-based arcade play. From a historical perspective, Nudge-It represents one of Gottlieb's experimental designs during the final years of large-scale American pinball manufacturing. Unlike standard pinball machines, the absence of flippers was intentional, encouraging physical interaction and timing rather than reflex-based flipper control. This design makes Nudge-It stand out among collectors as a novelty machine with strong visual appeal and an approachable learning curve for casual players. Production & Rarity: Exact production figures for Nudge-It were not formally published, but collector consensus and industry references generally estimate production at approximately 2,000 units or fewer, making it a relatively low-production title compared to mainstream pinball machines of the era. As a result, surviving examples-particularly complete, powered-on machines-are considered uncommon on today's secondary market.This electrical standing arcade game by Gottlieb stands 22" X 37" X 57" high at the back. The spring-attached knob releases the silver chrome ball perfectly. No flappers were designed for this arcade game. The idea was to "nudge" the ball into the lit lane. This electrical standing arcade game measures approximately 22 inches wide by 37 inches deep and 57 inches high at the back. The spring-attached plunger releases the chrome ball smoothly, and the illuminated playfield elements activate as designed. No flippers were manufactured for this game, as nudging the cabinet is the intended method of ball control. The cabinet, backglass, and playfield artwork display expected cosmetic wear consistent with age and commercial use.

ads.title: Pinball machine Hokus Pokus 1975 owned since 1979
ads.description: Had every switch , blade and contact filed and cleaned and machine shopped out in 2021 by Terri Irwin , a long time respected pinball mechanic in Ocala. Has a few lights out. Only issue is sometimes the score reel does not completely set over and you have to hit the button again to restart it. One of those Ghost in the machine kind of things that she just couldn't figure out . I have owned this game since 1979 when I received it as a kid. You might have seen this up for sale in the past and then the listing disappeared. This was a period of time when I needed money for something so I put it up for sale but then something else came through and I took it down because I didn't really want to sell it. At this point in life it is mostly just nostalgia. I just don't play it anymore. It is very fun game I am just bored with it after 45 years and want something different. Very open to trades for a newer pinball machine plus cash on my end. Thanks for looking! Nine zero four four four four one four three nine.. Dave

The picture convergence needs help. The jet ski needs an air compressor to make the ride functional which is missing so I never could test it. There's also a piece of aluminum trim on the left side of the jet ski that was missing when I got it. The Sega Model 2 inside has been replaced so the old one is included. You will need to bring a trailer with a ramp to load it. Both pieces are on wheels so it's relatively easy to move but very heavy.

Lethal Enforcers: pretty much fully working, the only issues is the heavy damage to the cabinet itself, and the player 1 and 2 start buttons are broken and would need replaced, I just didn't get that far yet Sega Turbo OutRun: This one has a working screen (imaged removed) and does not boot at all. There's power too it though and there is visual but it's garbled graphics. Lock-on by data east: This one has a dead screen and does not boot at all with a hardware error 29. Cobra Command (inside an atari cabinet?): Has a dead screen and does not boot at all. There's power too it though. Looking to try to get $500 per cabinet but any reasonable offer would be considered. Looking to sell outrun and the monitor separately

ads.author: Chris Tirro
ads.title: Solar City Pinball Machine
ads.description: Purchased this late last year from someone local who owned it for about 18 years. It is fully shopped and working with very good cosmetics. All playfield coils have good power. The playfield itself is in very good condition, with a little bit of flipper drag - see pics. I’d call the backglass about average condition, with a little touchup done. The main cabinet and backbox artwork is original and is very nice, with a little discoloration in the left bottom portion of the backbox front - again see the pic. The brackets and wiring for coin mechanisms are present but the removable coin mechs are not and the game is set up for free play. The playfield glass and legs are in good condition. If you’re looking for a good condition, well maintained electro-mechanical game that’s also fun to play, this would make a great addition to any collection. This machine has been kept in a climate controlled, smoke free environment and is sold as-is, where-is. Shipping is possible if the buyer makes all arrangements.

ads.author: Russel Benthal
ads.title: Classic 1981 Nintendo Donkey Kong Original Arcade Machine in Dedicated Cabinet TKG4-UP-US Blue
ads.description: Up for sale is an authentic piece of gaming history: an all original 1981 Nintendo Donkey Kong upright arcade machine. This is a dedicated cabinet featuring the iconic "Nintendo Blue" finish and original artwork. The machine has been recently brought back to life after years of storage. It is currently in fully playable condition and only needs a final dial-in of the H-hold coil on the monitor in order to be perfect, which I do not know how to do. All original parts with zero modifications or customizations other than bypassing the coin mechanism to allow free play (this can be reversed easily). ads.author: Rob Schoonmaker
ads.title: Die Hard Full Size Stand Up Arcade Game
ads.description: A 3-D side-scrolling fighting game based on the movie "Die Hard". Die Hard Arcade was produced by Sega in 1996. Sega released 594 machines in our database under this trade name, starting in 1960. Sega is based in Japan. Each SWAT member must fight every criminal and machine that they come across by punching them, kicking them as well as using various weapons and objects that they can get their hands on including handguns, machine guns, missile launchers, anti-tank cannons, knives, sticks, fireaxes, spray cans, pepper shakers, steel pipes, brooms, bottles and so on. Players can also pick up magazines for handguns and machine guns for extra ammuntion as well as health units for extra health. Also, on some sequences, players must press the Punch button, Kick button or Jump button or move the joystick in a specific direction in order to successfully get past certain enemies or obstacles. If either of the SWAT members fail on those sequences where they are supposed to punch or kick down those enemies, they will have to fight them in hand-to-hand combat.The SWAT members can also attack enemies when grabbing them and they can also arrest them when they grab them by pushing either the Punch or Kick button twice but only if the SWAT member has a handgun. When the SWAT members finally confront the crime boss, they will have to face him twice first in the office and then on the rooftop. On the rooftop, he will be armed with swords and more difficult to hurt. After, you defeat the crime boss for the second time, The President's daughter is rescued. If only one player is in the game, the girl just says "Thank You!" and the game ends. But if two players are in the game, after the girl says "Thank You!", she will want one of the SWAT members to become her new bodyguard as a thanks for rescueing her, so each player will have to fight each other until one of them is defeated and whoever wins will become the girl's new bodyguard but if time runs out, it will be a draw and the girl will be undecided about which SWAT member she wants for her new bodyguard. The game ends afterwards, regardless of the results.

ads.author: Glenn Musto
ads.title: Atari Tempest Arcade Machine – 1981 Classic Reproduction, w/ modern electronics
ads.description: Modern Re-Creation of the Legendary 1981 Atari Tempest Step back into the golden age of arcades—without the headaches of vintage hardware. This is a brand-new machine built in the style of the iconic Atari Tempest, faithfully recreating the sights, sounds, and gameplay of the original classic. Authentic Gameplay As a Tempest champion in the 1980s and owner of an original machine, I can personally vouch that the gameplay here is spot-on, indistinguishable from a brand-new Tempest as it played in arcades back in the day. Why This Machine Is Better The truth is, the original Tempest was a maintenance nightmare. Its color X-Y CRT monitor burned itself out, circuit boards constantly failed, and many machines ended up in the dump. That’s why working originals are nearly impossible to find—and even if you do, you’re stuck battling those same issues. This machine eliminates every one of those problems, while giving you more: 24" LCD with LED backlighting (IPS panel, any-angle viewing — no fragile CRT). New spinner with dual sealed bearings for silky-smooth precision control. 50-watt stereo sound system with subwoofer, volume control pod, and headphone jack (not just old mono sound). Commercial-grade power: 500+ watt ATX supply plus built-in 1,000-joule surge protector with EMI/RFI filtering. Universal JAMMA harness for plug-and-play swap of other JAMMA boards. Durable build: 3⁄4” commercial-grade cabinet, stainless steel control panel hardware, polycarbonate overlay and graphics (not scratch-prone vinyl). LED marquee lighting (no hot fluorescent bulbs). Poly wheels that roll without scratching floors. Freeplay setup for home use (no quarters required). Choice of keyed vault-style lock or thumb lock for the front door. Extra Features Tempest & Tempest Tubes — play classic levels and unlock options never before accessible. Levels 1 through 99 — explore stages you may have never reached in the arcade. Demonstration Mode: blast through tubes, clear spikes, or jump levels instantly—perfect for testing all 99 levels, whether you’re a pro or a newcomer. Why It Matters This is not just another retro cabinet with emulation slapped inside. It’s a commercial-grade, modernized Tempest machine built to last a lifetime, with gameplay so accurate that arcade veterans can’t tell the difference. Full instructions come with order, including game options, settings, default settings, etc. Defaults are: Game difficulty is Medium, Bonus Life awarded at 20,000 points, and 3 lives per game. Local pickup or buyer arranged packing and shipping. Game is located in Saint Petersburg Florida. If you want it shipped, I will make it available any time at my home for your freight company to pick it up. You must make all arrangements. Size at control panel - approx. 25" wide x 33" deep. Heigth - approx. 73" cabinet top to floor with wheels. Weight - approx. only 170 lbs. (thanks to the LCD/LED monitor). Palleted shipping weight - approx. 210 lbs.

ads.title: ORIGINAL 1980s TRON Arcade Machine – ALL ORIGINAL – Collector Quality $8,000
ads.description: This is a true collector’s TRON arcade, not a conversion, not a replica, not a rebuild. Original 1980s Midway TRON cabinet, beautifully preserved and operates perfectly. I showed interest in selling this about a month ago but waited until I could properly assess value. After researching recent sales ranging from $6,000–$12,000, I’m asking $8,000 for this exceptionally complete, original example. DETAILS: • Original 1980s TRON arcade cabinet • Original CRT monitor (excellent picture) • Upgraded power supply for improved reliability • Cabinet in excellent condition • All lights fully functional • Lighting restored using original fluorescent and original black light (no cheap LED swaps) • Original control stick installed + extra original control stick included • Includes original owner’s manual • Includes original service manual • Includes spare NOS (New Old Stock) parts • Everything works exactly as it should This is a machine for someone who understands what they’re looking at — originality, condition, and completeness matter here, and this one checks all the boxes. Price: $8,000 Serious collectors only. No trades. Local pickup or buyer arranged freight. If you know TRON arcades, you already know how hard it is to find one this original and complete. Message me if you’re genuinely interested.

ads.author: Blake Williams
ads.title: Pulp Fiction LE
ads.description: Low plays excellent shape Looking to trade or sell. The Pulp Fiction LE Pinball Machine is a limited-edition, officially licensed pinball game from Chicago Gaming Company that pays tribute to Quentin Tarantino’s cult classic film. It blends retro-inspired 1990s pinball aesthetics with modern features and deep gameplay, all themed around the movie’s iconic characters, quotes, and soundtrack. This “Bad Mother Flipper” Limited Edition machine includes exclusive touches like a numbered plaque, custom Jack Rabbit Slim’s topper, vintage-style art, interior mirror blades, shaker motor, and enhanced LED lighting. The playfield is designed by legendary pinball designer Mark Ritchie and packed with thematic elements such as interactive briefcase toys, sculpted character figures, dynamic lighting, and cinematic callouts. Audio and visuals draw you into the Pulp Fiction world with 250+ legendary lines from the film’s cast, five licensed songs from the soundtrack, and custom compositions throughout gameplay. Only 1,000 LE units were produced, making it a collectible centerpiece for fans and pinball and film lover. TRADE OR SELL

ads.author: Mike Mackey
ads.title: Nintendo HELIFIRE 1980 arcade cocktail game - ONLY 2017 Plays
ads.description: (Located near Lexington, KY) VERY RARE cocktail version of game only 2017 plays on coin counter. Nintendo HeliFire is rarely found in the wild—it’s the rarest of Nintendo’s early video arcade lineup. It came out after Radar Scope, both released in 1980, and prior to Donkey Kong, the game that made Nintendo famous. HeliFire had the “TUB-up” designation stamped on both the cabinet top plate and the monitor frame. This example has both, so it’s definitely a legit Nintendo build and not a conversion. And far rarer, than the already much sought after upright cabinet; because cocktail are produced in a much smaller percentage than uprights. Everything is original. Has switching power supply installed, but includes the original power supply as well. All boards have been serviced: socketed chips removed and legs cleaned, all tantalum caps replaced, nearly all electrolytic caps replaced. Monitor has been recapped. It has run for multiple hours at a time in attract mode and in play, both to burn in and to flush out any potential issues with the servicing. No problems have occurred. There are only 13 acknowledged owners of HeliFire in the VAPS (Video Arcade Preservation Society) census (combined uprights and cocktails). The VAPS numbers are a bit confusing because they only specify member activity from the past three years. Current VAPS stats list 3 uprights and 3 cocktails. Of course, there are likely more examples out in the wild, as not everyone records their serial numbers with VAPS. Walkthrough vid here: https://youtu.be/7-H8C4wyWbQ?si=xUoLG-4BUlTYWABm I will palletize for $30. I have palletized and shipped numerous arcade/pinball games with no issues, and my palletizing is far better than any shipper. Guaranteed secure payment requested (cash, bank wire transfer or equivalent). Pick-up available at our Winchester, KY warehouse. FaceTime walk-through available upon request. Any questions are welcome.

ads.author: John Eric Booth
ads.title: Operation Thunderbolt Arcade Shooter Game - Fully Restored! Incredible!
ads.description: Hey John here from Gameroom Medic! Here is an incredible, fully restored Taito "Operation Thunderbolt" 2-player arcade game from my own collection. It's amazing! This will make someone an outstanding addition to their home arcade and take advantage of a great opportunity! This game is awesome! Last year I performed an intensive, full restoration on this machine... ya gotta see it in person to fully appreciate. This one's from 1989 and let me tell ya, you'd think it's brand new. The coin door was completely disassembled and repainted as well as all coin mechanism parts working perfectly, along with sparkling new vinyl cabinet artwork throughout. Several improvements were made as well including new upper speakers and the addition of a mid-bass speaker and amplifier for added impact! An aluminum footrest (one of my signature mods) replaced the plastic version. New dolly-style casters have been installed. A 25" minty fresh Wells Gardner K7000 monitor provides a stunning picture. The color is vibrant and screen is crystal clear... no burn in! The Uzi machine guns have both been completely disassembled and cleaned. New potentiometers were installed as well. The recoil feature is super fun and works beautifully! Inside the unit is equally impressive. Completely cleaned and painted along with cleaned wiring harnesses. A new power supply has been installed and main PC board fully recapped. This is without a doubt an archive quality machine, completely solid and ready for great game play. I challenge you to find this game in equal condition anywhere! No trades. Cash only. I hate to see this one go but I just don't have room for it. It's big! And heavy! Delivery can be provided but rental of a full liftgate box truck will be necessary. I will not respond to auto-generated messages such as "is this available?" Serious inquiries only please. I welcome your questions, and any respectable offers.

ads.author: Tom Grizzard
ads.title: 1978 Bally PLAYBOY pinball machine -New Playfield, new cabinet decals
ads.description: Experience nostalgia with this classic 1978 Bally PLAYBOY pinball machine. This machine has been given a new lease of life with a brand new playfield and cabinet decals, making it the perfect addition to any arcade or pinball collection. The machine boasts the iconic PLAYBOY branding and provides endless hours of entertainment for all ages. Don't miss out on the chance to own this timeless piece of gaming history. Notable Features: Flippers (2), Pop bumpers (3), Slingshots (2), Standup targets (6), 5-bank drop targets (1), Star rollover (1), Upper left kickback lane (the Grotto). The backglass depicts Hugh Hefner with 1976 Playmate Patti McGuire and 1977 Playmate Sondra Theodore. Tom Nieman, VP of Marketing for Bally Pinball, told us his name or initials appeared on most backglasses of this time period for which he obtained the license. On this game, his name appears on the champagne bottle. The start-up tune, Grotto tune, and bonus score countdown tune resemble portions of Cy Coleman's "Playboy's Theme" from the 1969 TV show "Playboy After Dark". An article in the Spring 2019 issue of Playboy magazine about the "Singing Playmates" mentioned that their producer Vic Caesar "arranged the surprisingly famous theme to the Playboy pinball game." Good condition. Everything works. Will ship via freight carrier at buyer's expense... contact for quote. Local delivery available for a nominal fee.

Police Trainer is a target shooting simulation game that takes 1 or 2 players through a series of levels created to help develop skills such as accuracy, speed, decision making, etc., as you compete for high scores. This game has been a lot of fun for our family and friends. It is all target shooting so there's no blood or actual violence; rated for mature responsible ages and individuals. ads.author: Jennifer Melvin Otten
ads.title: Williams “Big Guns” Pinball Machine - 1987
ads.description: The "Big Guns" pinball machine, released by Williams in 1987, was designed by Mark Ritchie and Python Anghelo and features a unique medieval-space theme. It is known for its tall backbox with a bagatelle mini-game, a two-tiered playfield, and innovative features like catapults that launch the ball, multiple ball savers, and four flippers. The game's objective is to rescue a queen from a castle by using the "big guns". Key historical and design details Manufacturer and Release: The machine was produced by Williams Electronics Games, Inc. in October 1987. Designers: Mark Ritchie designed the playfield, while Python Anghelo handled much of the artwork and overall design concept. Theme: The game blends a medieval setting with science fiction, featuring a king holding a queen hostage in a castle that is attacked by futuristic military forces. Backbox and Bagatelle: The backbox is taller than average to accommodate the "King's Chamber," a bagatelle-style mini-game where players can win bonuses or an extra ball by skillfully launching a ball into it. Innovations: Catapults: Two catapults on the playfield are used to launch the ball into the upper playfield or a habitrail. Four Flippers: The machine has four flippers, including two on the main playfield and two on an upper playfield, adding a unique two-level gameplay experience. Ball Savers: To make the game less frustrating, it includes multiple anti-frustration features like a kickback, a center pop-up post, and an outlane diverter. Recognition: "Big Guns" was well-received at the time, with Play Meter magazine calling it the best pinball machine at the 1987 AMOA show. All components of the game works including the ball on the scoreboard. All art work is in great condition. More video available upon request. Local pickup only

If you know anything about me, you know I take great pride in my work. This is no exception. Is it cheap? No. But unlike any pin that you got for cheap... this one needs nothing and had no expense spared. ads.author: Austin White
ads.title: 1995 Gottlieb Big Hurt Pinball
ads.description: Up for sale is this 1995 Gottlieb Frank Thomas Big Hurt. This machine was completely gone through (recently) and is nicer than how it left the factory! The playfield was stripped down, cleaned and waxed. Old incandescent bulbs and flashers were replaced with modern LED’s in the playfield and backbox. All rubbers were replaced and coils were replaced as well. New flipper bats. New drop target stickers, new balls, New legs, bolts and leg levelers as well as new side rails were installed. Coin door was stripped and repainted. Custom inner side art installed. Cabinet art and translite are in very very nice shape for it’s age. All serial numbers matching, and only 1,985 were ever produced! This is a clean example and perfect for your man cave whether you’re a pinball collector or a baseball fanatic. Local pickup preferred in Bartlett, TN but you’re welcome to set up shipping. For an additional fee I can have the machine palletized and your shipper can pick it up directly at my loading dock. Any questions feel free to reach out!

ads.author: Rob LaDue
ads.title: Black Rose Pinball Machine - Pirate Themed
ads.description: Gorgeous Black Rose Pinball Machine -Pirate Themed This beautiful Black Rose, pirate-themed, pinball machine was produced in 1992 and features many unique game elements, including a pop-up twisting cannon shot to sink ships and shoot bonus shots, video-mode bonus games (uses the flippers to play a Knife Throwing, Walk-the-Plank, and Swing-from-the-Rigging analog video game), Easter-egg bonuses for trick shots, treasure bonuses, parrot bonus, etc. Play is flawless! All plastics and metals are in great condition, and the lights, cannon, analog display, 3 flippers, plunger, sound, and ball eject perform perfectly. Complete Operations Manual included. This machine has been lovingly used for home play since our purchase of it in 2008. We are a smoke free home. At the time of purchase, the machine had been completely shopped, including replacing many of the older incandescent lighting with LEDs. Some of the incandescent lights were retained to provide some of that old school pinball feel. All rubbers were replaced last year, a pinball specialist gave it a once over in December 2024, and the field was recently rewaxed. The cabinet and playfield are near flawless and the legs are free of rust. Before being returned to the States for its reshop in 2007, this machine was exported to Italy. It retains its original Italian lire coin return buttons. The game speaks and displays English (go figure!). The coin change box was missing when we acquired it, but is easily found on the internet. For an older (and more affordable) pinball game, Black Rose has so-ooo many different and unique elements and shots, that our family never got tired of it (our moving necessitates the sale). The pirate theme is exciting for both adults and children too and for those that desire, the game can be upgraded with the Skull and Bones kit, which changes the game in many interesting ways. Please message me with any questions and I will do the best I can to answer them. Play tests can also be arranged (located in Bradenton, FL). Shipping must be arranged by the buyer. Beautiful machine! Thanks!

ads.author: Donald Hopkins
ads.title: AC DC Luci Pinball Game - Limited Edition
ads.description: I bought this from a friend on 3/7/21. An original Luci was on my list for a long time. The vault Luci has the gawd awful ugly black band around the lower playfield with all the screws holding it in. The original is the Luci to have if you can find one. Many tasteful mods including chrome stage cover, cannon, "Luci bell", lit train, color DMD, flipper fidelity speakers, lit topper, shaker motor, LEDs and more. See pics. This game has the jukebox mode. You hold both flippers while in attract mode and an old school radio comes up on the DMD. You press the flipper buttons L or R to tune the "station" and play all the songs in the game. With the upgraded speakers, it sounds amazing!

ads.author: Scott Nielsen
ads.title: Vintage operations manual for a Williams Electronics Games pinball machine, specifically the
ads.description: Vintage operations manual for a Williams Electronics Games pinball machine, specifically the "Whitewater" model, as indicated by the prominent "Whitewater Pinball" text in relevant search results. The manual, published in December 1992, includes sections on: Operations & Adjustments Testing & Problem Diagnosis Parts Information Wiring Diagrams & Schematics The manual was produced by Williams Electronics Games, Inc., located in Chicago, IL. The distinctive artwork on the manual cover features two large, hairy, ape-like creatures (possibly Bigfoots or Yetis) emerging from a mountain or rock formation, reflecting the "Whitewater" theme, which often incorporates elements of nature and adventure. For more information please call or message me. Located in Spencer Tennessee. [hidden information]

ads.title: 1978 Stern Nugent Pinball Machine
ads.description: Brand new Alltek Mpu, new rubbers and balls (not seen in pics), rebuilt upper flipper, game plays great! Backglass itself is a 7 out of 10, with some flaking and missing pieces of art along bottom edge, also has an extremely rusty lift bar that seems to have fused itself to the glass, and i didn't want to risk breaking original glass to remove and replace, it still functions just need to be gentle and lift from corners, displays are all original and work well, player 2 has some artifacting going on but is easily fixed or replace all with modern Leds should you choose, playfield is a 9 out of 10, very minimal wear, plays great! Cabinet artwork has the usual bumps and scrapes and fading for a 47 year old game, but is overall pretty nice, I'd say a 6 out of 10, these pics were taken before I swapped rubbers out and cleaned playfield and plastics, then my phone died, will add new pics when new phone arrives Important Terms of Sale – Please Read Carefully This pinball machine is being sold AS-IS, WHERE-IS with NO WARRANTY EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED. The game has been fully described to the best of my ability and is in working order at the time it leaves my shop. Once the machine leaves my possession, I am not responsible for any issues, damage, adjustments, or failures that may occur during shipping, transport, setup, or ownership. No returns. No refunds. No exchanges. Pinball machines are complex electromechanical devices and may require routine maintenance, adjustments, or minor repairs after transport. Buyer assumes all responsibility once the machine is picked up or shipped. By purchasing this item, the buyer acknowledges and agrees that they have reviewed all photos, read the description in full, and understand the nature of buying a used pinball machine.

ads.author: Steve Thorson
ads.title: Star Wars ep.1 Pinball Machine
ads.description: In great shape and fully working. Minor playfield wear from normal use. All lights, switches, sounds, mechs, light saber, and features work 100%. Playfield lights have been converted to LED for improved reliability and brightness. Released in 1999, this game holds a unique place in pinball history as the final game ever produced by Williams, the last remaining manufacturer of the Golden Age of pinball. It’s also one of only two pinball machines ever made to feature an interactive hologram projected onto the playfield, making it not just historically significant, but innovative and a genuinely fun game to play. Would make a great addition to a game room or Christmas gift for a Star Wars fan. Open to trades for other pinball machines.

ads.author: Kevin Coughlin
ads.title: 1979 Williams Gorgar Pinball Machine
ads.description: 1979 Williams Gorgar pinball machine in very good condition, all original boards all in very nice condition and working and playing perfectly, no battery damage to board but will need a new battery holder installed or NVRam to save settings and high scores, I haven't done it.. just have to turn it in and off and on again real quick to boot it up.. doesn't bother me.. backglass is an 8 out of 10 with minimal wear and flaking, the original scoreboards all work, sometimes players 3-4 take a little while to warm up, sound and speech is perfect and awesome! Playfield is a 9 out of 10, very minimal wear, same with cabinet art, game has been cleaned and shopped and had leds added to GI and backbox, incandescent bulbs in all playfield lights.. I been playing it for last year and I need space back in my shop, time for it to find a new home! I also have added white carrot flippers to it ... all new rubbers and ball, waxed and cleaned and ready to rock! Gorgar was the first talking pinball machine with a vocabulary of seven words: Gorgar, Speaks, Beat, You, Me, Hurt, Got. The words could be combined together for different phrases. This may sound rather ridiculous 40 years later but was absolutely leading edge in 1979, not only for the pinball-industry but for technology in general, and nobody should forget that. Plus, after the sensational success of FLASH, it was the second SS-milestone for Williams and did a further important step to beat Bally and becoming #1 in the industry. It still ranks at #15 of the most produced Flippergames ever. Important Terms of Sale – Please Read Carefully This pinball machine is being sold AS-IS, WHERE-IS with NO WARRANTY EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED. The game has been fully described to the best of my ability and is in working order at the time it leaves my shop. Once the machine leaves my possession, I am not responsible for any issues, damage, adjustments, or failures that may occur during shipping, transport, setup, or ownership. No returns. No refunds. No exchanges. Pinball machines are complex electromechanical devices and may require routine maintenance, adjustments, or minor repairs after transport. Buyer assumes all responsibility once the machine is picked up or shipped. By purchasing this item, the buyer acknowledges and agrees that they have reviewed all photos, read the description in full, and understand the nature of buying a used pinball machine.

ads.author: Gary Cable
ads.title: Rare Gottlieb ”CAVEMAN” Pinball
ads.description: 1982 Gottlieb CAVEMAN 4-Player Pinball Machine • Playfield, Backglass and Cabinet are all in good condition. • All lighting replaced with Comet 2SMD LED lamps. • New set of drop targets, and rubber rings installed. • Playfield completely stripped, cleaned and waxed. • Includes keys front and back, manual and spare instruction/score cards. • 100% working and very clean – Game Room Ready. Theme: Cavemen; Dinosaurs; Historical Specialty: Widebody Notable Features: Flippers (4), Pop bumpers (3), 4-bank drop targets (2), Vari-targets (2), Kick-out holes (2). A video game screen is mounted at top center of the playfield. Video game time is won while playing pinball. Video play is controlled by a joystick mounted on the lockdown bar. The Extra Ball is earned via the video game. The video also displays instructions during Game Over mode. GOTTLIEB “CAVEMAN” Caveman Pinball is the first "pinball with a video game" design ever tried by the big 5 manufacturers. Its wide body cabinet and 3/4 size playfield also contained a video game monitor and a joystick. Its 13-inch RGB video game monitor was built into the center-rear portion of the playfield and the joystick was positioned in the top-center of the larger than normal lockdown bar. Caveman Pinball was released soon after the very popular Haunted House pinball and captured some of the deep, resonant sounds that the early '80's Gottlieb pinballs created. $1,800 PM Gary for more info Located in Connellsville, Pa 15425

All lights have been upgraded to LEDs including non-ghosting inserts, all GI and all flashers. NVRAM was added to the MPU to eliminate batteries. Additional new parts include: - Pin2DMD color display - Rottendog power supply board - New sheet of playfield glass - Several ball trough switches - All plastic star posts - Translucent silicon rubbers - Silicone post sleeves and flipper rubbers - Mirror-finish pinballs - Cabinet flipper buttons - Legs - Leg bolts - Leg levelers - Custom instruction cards Location: Pittsburgh, PA

ads.description: Selling an original Midway Gauntlet Dark Legacy arcade cabinet in excellent working condition. This is the full-size original dedicated 4-player machine — not a conversion an not an Arcade1Up. Everything works exactly as it should and it’s ready to drop straight into your game room. Features & Condition Monitor professionally recapped a few months ago — bright CRT with strong color Original dedicated cabinet with great artwork and solid structure Includes original operator’s manual Convertible wheel system — roll it into place, then jack down onto sturdy feet All controls fully working (joysticks, buttons, sound, coin door) Clean inside and out — no swelling, no wiring hacks Plays perfectly — ready to enjoy immediately About the Game One of the best co-op arcade games ever made. Supports 4 players with epic hack-and-slash gameplay, tons of characters, and long campaign content. A fan favorite and a centerpiece for any collection. Price $1900 Located in Raymore, MO Happy to help load. ads.author: Adrian Melendez
ads.title: Non-Marring Playfield Stands (Black) - Free US Shipping
ads.description: If you work on your own pinball machines, these make shop work easier, safer, and way less annoying. These are purpose-built playfield stands designed by pinball repair and restoration folks to securely support a playfield above the cabinet while you work. They hold the playfield stable without resting it on cabinet rails or forcing you to lean into the machine. Printed in durable TPU (rubber-like material), not hard plastic. That means they’re tough, slightly flexible, and won’t chip, crack, or damage your cabinet or playfield edges if bumped. Why these are better than rigid stands or improvised supports: Non-marring TPU material protects cabinet rails and playfield edges Slight flex absorbs bumps instead of transferring impact Stable enough for modern playfields with ramps, upper PFs, and heavy wiring No slipping, no scratching, no stress on the cabinet Way more comfortable access for shop outs and repairs Great for: Full shop jobs and cleanings Switch and mech work Rubber swaps and wiring repairs Ramp or upper playfield removal General tear-downs and troubleshooting Details: Made from tough TPU (abrasion resistant, impact resistant) Works with most Stern, Bally/Williams, JJP, CGC, Spooky, American Pinball, and Data East/Sega games Lightweight and easy to store in a tool bag or drawer Available in multiple colors Includes: One pair (2) TPU playfield stands Color choice available These are something you’ll use every time you open a game once you have them. Clean, simple, and designed to protect your machines while making work easier.

ads.author: Rob Schoonmaker
ads.title: Gate Of Doom 1990 Full Size Stand Up Arcade Game
ads.description: Gate of Doom, known in Japan as Dark Seal (ダークシール), is a hack 'n slash game developed by Data East and released in 1990 for arcades. Gate of Doom is a hack 'n slash game which uses a top-down, isometric perspective. Players can choose between four different characters, each with their own characteristics and abilities. The player can move and attack in eight directions, as well as unleash a powerful spell once its accumulated enough magic power. Much like in Karnov, the player can pick between available spells by tapping the joystick left and right. Levels are filled with enemies and traps, as well as treasure chests which the player can open to obtain various items and power-ups which give passive boosts to the character.

Very desirable setup for home arcade, barcade, or collector. Machine powers on and runs Both sides linked and playable Original steering wheels, shifters, pedals, seats, coin doors Original CRT monitors installed Condition / Notes: Game works and is playable. Occasionally the screen image freezes, which is consistent with aging CRT monitors on these Sega cabinets. Very common issue. Excellent candidate for CRT service or LCD monitor conversion, which is a popular and straightforward upgrade and greatly increases value. Cosmetic wear consistent with age and arcade use. Stored indoors. Heavy commercial cabinet — buyer must bring truck and help for pickup. Why this is a great buy: Twin cabinets are much harder to find than singles Daytona USA 2 is a classic and always in demand Perfect project with big upside after monitor refresh Price: $3,500 OBO

This is the full-size coin-operated model — the same style found in bars, restaurants, and game rooms. The machine is in excellent working order and has been well-maintained. Screen is bright and clear, trackball rolls smoothly, and all buttons and controls work properly. Cabinet is clean and solid. Features: • Official Golden Tee 2025 software • Commercial coin-operated model • Bill acceptor installed • Network ready (for online play, stats, and tournaments) • Includes stand • Can be set to free play if desired • Large monitor • Plug and play — ready to go Condition details: • Fully tested and working • No gameplay or system issues • Normal cosmetic wear from use (nothing major) Pickup / Delivery: • Local pickup preferred • I can help load — it’s heavy, so please bring a truck or trailer Reason for selling: No longer needed / making room for something else. arcade game, golden tee, golf arcade, coin op game, commercial arcade, man cave, bar game, game room, touch screen arcade, networked arcade

ads.author: Nicole Aston
ads.title: Area 51 Atari Arcade Machine
ads.description: COME PICK UP! From the manufacturer: The 1995 video game Area 51 is a light gun shooter arcade game developed by Messa Logic and published by Atari Games. Players take on a role of a member of the Strategic Tactical Advanced Alien Response (S.T.A.A.R.) team, fighting against an alien invasion by the Akron and their zombie-like creations at the infamous Area 51 military base. The game was known for its use of digitalized video and sprites, and it was later ported to home consoles like the PlayStation, Sega Saturn and Windows. The machine does need SOME work. I’m not sure why though. It turns on, the screen is no longer visible, you used to be able to play it for a while, it has sound. Always wanted this machine and sad to see it go. Moved into an apartment and don’t have the room for it.
